metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9083 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
poppler 0.54.0, as used in Evince and other products, has a NULL pointer dereference in the JPXStream::readUByte function in JPXStream.cc. For example, the perf_test utility will crash (segmentation fault) when parsing an invalid PDF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> I didn't inspect texlive-bin or luatex closely since I didn't spot a patch quickly mdeslaur> while Debian uses openjpeg, Ubuntu uses the internal JPX decoder texlive-bin is built with --with-system-poppler and --with-system-xpdf, so embedded code copy isn't used.

criterions.comment: poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.2').
